intro: Lapsana olympica, commonly known as the Olympic hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, which is typical of the family. It typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Lapsana olympica is often found in regions with temperate climates and can be a common sight in naturalized areas.
